data.title: Prog/Power Metal
data.meta_description:
What are some of you favorite prog/power metal albums/bands?

Some of mine are:

Symphony X - The Odyssey
Symphony X - V
Pagan's Mind - Celestial...
data.text:
These kinda wander all over the place...

Symphony X - The Divine Wings of Tragedy

Blind Guardian - Imaginations From the Other Side

Angra - Holy Land

Biomechanical - The Empires of the Worlds

Athena - A New Religion?

Into Eternity - Buried In Oblivion

Orphaned Land - Mabool: The story of the Three Sons of Seven (if this isn't prog metal, I don't know what is.)

Morgana Lefay - Grand Materia

Tad Morose - Undead

Queensryche - Rage For Order

Pharaoh - The Longest Night

Rage - Soundchaser

WatchTower - Control and Resistance

Kamelot - The Fourth Legacy

Bruce Dickinson - The Chemical Wedding

Therion - Theli

Nevermore - The Politics of Ecstacy

Eh, that's a good start...

Power metal:

Stratovarius - All of their stuff, but my favorites are Episode, Intermission, Infinite, and Destiny. I can listen to them for hours on end. Superb stuff.

Really liking Nightwish lately - the Wishmaster album.

Does Division count?

Prog metal:

Dream Theater - Especially Images And Words and Awake, but I love basically all of their stuff.

Symphony X - Anything at all.

Pain Of Salvation - Nothing specific, but Gildenlow is crazy. In a good way.

Fates Warning - It's all good stuff. Jim Matheos is an awesome riff writer.

Freak Kitchen - Don't know if I could classify them as anything, but I think some of their stuff counts as prog metal - especially the Move album.

If I can even come close to remembering them all...

Manticora - Hyperion

Nocturnal Rites - Shadowland

Into Eternity - Buried In Oblivion

Iced Earth - Something Wicked This Way Comes

Primal Fear - Nuclear Fire

Sinergy - To Hell And Back

Blind Guardian - Nightfall In Middle Earth

Demons & Wizards - Self Titled

Therion - Vovin

Labyrinth - Return To Heaven Denied

HammerFall - Legacy of Kings

Dream Evil - The Book Of Heavy Metal

Symphorce - Godspeed

Biomechanical - The Empires of the Worlds

and I can't remember any more... my head hurts.

Oh dear god, long list....

Arwen - Illusions

Blind Guardian - Nightfall In Middle Earth

Communic - Conspiracy In Mind

Crystal Eyes - Confessions Of The Maker

Demons & Wizards - Demons & Wizards

Dragonforce - Valley Of The Damned

Dream Theater - Images And Words

Evergrey - Solitude-Dominance-Tragedy

Fates Warning - Parallels

Firewind - Burning Earth

Iced Earth - Something Wicked This Way Comes

Ion Vein - Reigning Memories

Kamelot - The Fourth Legacy

Lost Horizon - A Flame To The Ground Beneath

Mystic Prophecy - Never Ending

Nevermore - The Politics Of Ecstacy

Nocturnal Rites - Grand Illusion

Oratory - Beyond Earth

O.S.I. - O.S.I.

Pharaoh - After The Fire

Queensryche - Operation Mindcrime

Sanctuary - Into The Mirror Black

Savatage - Edge Of Thorns

Shadow Keep - A Chaos Theory

Sinergy - Suicide by My Side

Sonata Arctica - Winterheart's Guild

Stratovarius - Destiny

Sun Caged - Sun Caged

Symphony X - V: The New Mythology Suite

Hmm, that's all I can think of at the moment, hard to pick one CD from some of these bands....

Jerich said:

ADAGIO...........................

Stephan Forte' interview for www.sevenstring.org comming in a few days...........

check out the new cd "Dominate"

also guys check out SYMPHORCE stellar...7 string power metal...

I'm desperate to hear the new album, as I love that band, but I still have to pay horrible import prices to get it here in the UK...grrrr!

Can't wait for that interview though!

Akrin said:

Does Division count?

I don't know if we do, but thanks for listening!

Dream Theater - Images and Words, Awake

Rush - everything before Power Windows, and then a few after that.

King's X - everything before Ear Candy, and Please Come Home Mr. Bulbous

King Crimson - just about everything, they're constantly brilliant

Queensryche - Operation Mindcrime, Empire

Into Eternity - Buried In Oblivion (thanks, Mike)

Zero Hour - Towers of Avarice (double thanks, Mike)

Nevermore - whatever you're willing to count, I love it all

Mawdyson said:

Nothing came up, I'll try again.

I dont see any samples online for them, they are easily the best power metal band IMO, best singer, best guitars, best keyboards, best songs.

Its like if you take stratovarious, and gamma ray and mix them together you get some super band

another amazing power metal band not many people know about

Lost Horizon, star trek metal. LOL this band has the best singer ever

http://www.oncelosthorizon.com/

here is a link to them

Samer said:

I dont see any samples online for them, they are easily the best power metal band IMO, best singer, best guitars, best keyboards, best songs.

Its like if you take stratovarious, and gamma ray and mix them together you get some super band

another amazing power metal band not many people know about

Lost Horizon, star trek metal. LOL this band has the best singer ever

http://www.oncelosthorizon.com/

here is a link to them

Err... Used to have the best singer ever... Daniel left LH, joined Crystal Eyes long enough to do 1 album(which I listed above) and now he and the 2nd guitarist from LH have started a band called Heed. Heed sounds like Creed, Disturbed, and Stratovarius had a mutant love child. The only thing I like about Heed are the vocals. I wish he'd stayed with Lost Horizon or at the least Crystal Eyes.

They're more "HIghlander" metal than Star Trek though. Hell, the mention The Quickening and have a song called The One(Highlander). Definitely need to lose the face-paint and costumes.
